freenet.support.math
Class BootstrappingDecayingRunningAverage

java.lang.Object
  freenet.support.math.BootstrappingDecayingRunningAverage
All Implemented Interfaces:
RunningAverage, Serializable
public final class BootstrappingDecayingRunningAverage
extends Object
implements RunningAverage

Exponential decay "running average".

Author:
amphibian For the first maxReports reports, this is equivalent to a simple running average. After that it is a decaying running average with a decayFactor of 1 / maxReports. We accomplish this by having decayFactor = 1/(Math.min(#reports, maxReports)). We can therefore:
  • Specify maxReports more easily than an arbitrary decay factor.
  • We don't get big problems with influence of the initial value, which is usually not very reliable.
See Also:
Serialized Form

setCurrentValue

protected double setCurrentValue(double d)
Not a public method. Changes the internally stored currentValue and return the old one. Used by DecayingKeyspaceAverage to normalize the stored averages. Calling this function may (purposefully) destroy the utility of the average being kept.
